job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: Modis has partnered with a unique company located in the Seattle, WA area to help find an experienced Software Engineer. The Client is a GIS software and services firm, and they create custom applications for both the web as well as distributed and scalable workflow applications. Many of their applications rely on specialty GIS/mapping software, especially from the MapInfo family of products.As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for creating custom web and desktop applications in a collaborative team environment, writing mostly in C# and Javascript/Typescript and using numerous third party packages including cartographic and database tools. About 80% of your time will be spent creating features - planning, research, writing code (including unit tests), and reviewing. You will also support the Operations team in their work on acceptance testing, deployment, and technical support. The other 20% of your time will be spent on agile process meetings including daily standups, ad hoc planning meetings, biweekly retrospectives, lunch and learn events, and staff meetings.Skills You Will Use:TECHNICALï· 4+ years of professional software engineering/development experienceï· Write front and back-end code with unit tests.ï· Model solutions to geometric, cartographic, and statistical problems.ï· Solve bugs efficiently.ï· Take unfamiliar code and figure out what it is doing.ï· Create complex SQL queries and analyze indexing for performance.ï· Ability to quickly learn new software and technical skillsï· Ability to research and troubleshoot technical issuesï· Ability to follow and understand a complex distributed algorithmSOCIAL/COOPERATIVEï· Strong written and oral communication skillsï· Collaborative approach with team membersï· Ability to prioritize and shift smoothly between tasksï· Resolve interpersonal conflicts professionallyï· Ability to accept and offer constructive feedbackï· Willingness to ask for and offer help as neededï· Willingness to take ownership of responsibilities and decisionsï· Active engagement with commitment to helping create an inclusive workplace.Benefits:ï· a comprehensive health insurance planï· company matching 401K retirement planï· standard business holidays (including your birthday)ï· sick and safe time exceeding the requirements of Seattle lawï· vacation time starting at 10 days per year and increasing to a maximum of 17 days per yearï· a yearly profit-sharing bonusï· optional 40 hours paid volunteer timeï· annual COLA salary adjustmentsï· Monthly âoppositeâ days to pursue innovation ideas and present to the team.
